from * to end kelbourne woolens scout 100% wool 274 yds/100 gm row 2 ws *k2 sl1yo k1 repeat from * to 1 st rem k1 skein hazelnut heather 245 4 4 5 5 6 7 8 8 skeins row 3 p1 *p1 sl1yo p2 repeat from * to end gauge row 4 *k2 brk2 k1 repeat from * to 1 st rem k1 20 sts + 32 row = 4 10 cm in tiny tuck stitch on larger row 5 p1 *p3 k1 repeat from * to 4 sts rem p4 ndls after blocking row 6 k4 *sl1yo k3 repeat from * to 1 st rem k1 needles row 7 p1 *p3 sl1yo repeat from * to 4 sts rem p4 1 set us 2 2 75 mm dpns row 8 k4 *brk2 k3 repeat from * to 1 st rem k1 1 us 2 2 75 mm 16 40 cm circular repeat row 1 8 for patt 1 us 2 2 75 mm 24 60 cm circular or pair straights tiny tuck stitch chart 1 us 4 3 5 mm 24 60 cm circular or pair straights take time to check your gauge and adjust needle size s sweater 4 is designed to be worn with 4 10 cm ease as desired sample shown meas 39 5 please see schematic for more 3 detailed finished measurements 2 skills 1 mattress stitch picking up stitches short row shaping see useful tips pattern repeat chart key abbreviations brk2 knit the next stitch together with its 2 purl 1 on rs knit 1 on ws corresponding yos from the previous 2 row sl1yo bring the working yarn to the front of the work slip knit 1 on rs purl 1 on ws the next stitch purlwise bring the yarn over the needle and over the slipped stitch to the back slip 1 yo for a list of other commonly used abbreviations in this and other kelbourne woolens patterns please visit brk2 kelbournewoolens com/abbreviations worthy of note stitch patterns the spring sweater is worked in pieces from the bottom k1 p1 ribbing flat mult of 2 sts up as the tiny tuck stitch causes the fabric to grow row 1 rs k1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to 1 st rem k1 widthwise decreases are worked after the ribbing and row 2 ws p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to 1 st rem p1 the stitch is worked on a smaller needle than typically repeat row 1 2 for patt recommended for scout once the
